properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 6 at 1:38AM PST until February 7 at 9:22PM PST by NWS Seattle WA
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Seattle has issued a flood warning
for the following rivers in Washington...

Carbon River Near Fairfax affecting Pierce County

Moderate to heavy rain will continue over the central and southern
Cascades into Friday morning. This will drive the Carbon River near
Fairfax into the major flood category this evening.

The National Weather Service in Seattle has issued a

* Flood Warning for
The Carbon River Near Fairfax
* from early this morning to Friday evening.
* At  1:00 AM Thursday the stage was 12.1 feet.
* Flood stage is 13.5 feet.
* Major flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage around 5 AM
Thursday and crest near 15.4 feet around 10 PM Thursday. The river
will fall below flood stage Friday early afternoon.
* Impact...At 15.0 feet, the Carbon River will cause major flooding.
Swift and deep flood waters will inundate roads...including Carbon
River Rd...Pioneer Way...and SR 162...and residential areas near
Crocker and Orting.   Flooding will occur all along the river
including headwaters...tributaries...and other streams within and
near the Carbon River Basin.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive cars...vans...or trucks through flooded areas...this is
the cause of most flood related deaths in Washington. Be alert for
rapid changes and monitor developments by listening to NOAA Weather
radio or other local media.
